system.benefit: When you use a Force Power that successfully deals damage to the target, you can spend a Force Point to move the target -1 step along the Condition Track (in addition to any movement along the Condition Track imposed by the Force Power normally) provided your Use the Force check equals or exceeds the target's Damage Threshold.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When you use a Force Power that successfully deals damage to the target, you can spend a Force Point to move the target -1 step along the Condition Track (in addition to any movement along the Condition Track imposed by the Force Power normally) provided your Use the Force check equals or exceeds the target's Damage Threshold.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to move the target -3 steps along the Condition Track.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to move the target -3 steps along the Condition Track.

system.benefit: When you use a Force Power that has a Cone, line, or radius effect that originates from your square, you can spend a Force Point to have the Force Power originate from a square within 6 squares of you.
system.special: You still choose the direction of the Force Power as though you were standing in the chosen square.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When you use a Force Power that has a Cone, line, or radius effect that originates from your square, you can spend a Force Point to have the Force Power originate from a square within 6 squares of you.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power originate from any square within your line of sight.

Special: You still choose the direction of the Force Power as though you were standing in the chosen square.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power originate from any square within your line of sight.

system.benefit: When using a Force Power that has a range expressed numerically, you can spend a Force Point to multiply the range by 10.
system.special: This Force Secret does not remove the line of sight requirements.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When using a Force Power that has a range expressed numerically, you can spend a Force Point to multiply the range by 10.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the range to anywhere in the same Star System.

Special: This Force Secret does not remove the line of sight requirements.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the range to anywhere in the same Star System.

system.benefit: When you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to corrupt the Force Power. The Force Power gains the [Dark Side] descriptor, and opponents who have a Dark Side Score lower than yours take a -2 penalty to all Defense Scores against this activation of the Force Power.
system.special: You cannot use this Force Secret unless your Dark Side Score equals your Wisdom score. Force Powers that have the [Light Side] descriptor cannot be corrupted by the use of this Force Secret.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to corrupt the Force Power. The Force Power gains the [Dark Side] descriptor, and opponents who have a Dark Side Score lower than yours take a -2 penalty to all Defense Scores against this activation of the Force Power.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the penalty to opponents' Defense Scores to -5.

Special: You cannot use this Force Secret unless your Dark Side Score equals your Wisdom score. Force Powers that have the [Light Side] descriptor cannot be corrupted by the use of this Force Secret.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the penalty to opponents' Defense Scores to -5.

system.benefit: When using a Force Power that requires a Standard Action or Move Action to activate, you can spend a Force Point to activate the Force Power as a Swift Action instead.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When using a Force Power that requires a Standard Action or Move Action to activate, you can spend a Force Point to activate the Force Power as a Swift Action instead.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to activate the Force Power as a Reaction instead.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to activate the Force Power as a Reaction instead.

system.benefit: You can spend a Force Point to link a Force Power to the Force Power you use in the current round so that it goes off in the following round. You must choose two Force Powers - one for the current and one for the next round. Both selected Force Powers cannot be altered in any way, such as through Force Techniques, Force Secrets, or the use of Force Points. However, the second Force Power goes off in the following round as a Free Action at the start of your turn.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point

You can spend a Force Point to link a Force Power to the Force Power you use in the current round so that it goes off in the following round. You must choose two Force Powers - one for the current and one for the next round. Both selected Force Powers cannot be altered in any way, such as through Force Techniques, Force Secrets, or the use of Force Points. However, the second Force Power goes off in the following round as a Free Action at the start of your turn.

system.benefit: When you use a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to purify the Force Power. The Force Power gains the [Light Side] descriptor, and opponents who have a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher take a -2 penalty to all Defense Scores against this activation of the Force Power.
system.special: You cannot use this Force Secret if you have a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher. Force Powers that have the [Dark Side] descriptor cannot be purified with this Force Secret.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When you use a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to purify the Force Power. The Force Power gains the [Light Side] descriptor, and opponents who have a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher take a -2 penalty to all Defense Scores against this activation of the Force Power.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the penalty to opponents' Defense Scores to -5.

Special: You cannot use this Force Secret if you have a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher. Force Powers that have the [Dark Side] descriptor cannot be purified with this Force Secret.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the penalty to opponents' Defense Scores to -5.

system.benefit: When using a Force Power that deals damage, you can spend a Force Point to increase the Power's damage dice by 50%.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When using a Force Power that deals damage, you can spend a Force Point to increase the Power's damage dice by 50%.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to double the amount of damage dice.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to double the amount of damage dice.

system.benefit: Whenever you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to add one use of that Force Power to the Force Power Suite of one ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. Once used, the Force Power cannot be regained by any means, and if the Force Power is not used by the end of the ally's next turn, it is lost.
system.prerequisite: Successfully trained an Apprentice to knighthood (or the equivalent rank for other Force Traditions)
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

Whenever you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to add one use of that Force Power to the Force Power Suite of one ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. Once used, the Force Power cannot be regained by any means, and if the Force Power is not used by the end of the ally's next turn, it is lost.

You or the ally can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power lost at the end of the encounter, instead of the end of the ally's next turn.

Prerequisites: Successfully trained an Apprentice to knighthood (or the equivalent rank for other Force Traditions)
system.alternativeCost: You or the ally can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power lost at the end of the encounter, instead of the end of the ally's next turn.

system.benefit: When you activate a Force Power that targets only you, you ignore all Condition Track penalties to your Use the Force check to activate that Force Power.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point

When you activate a Force Power that targets only you, you ignore all Condition Track penalties to your Use the Force check to activate that Force Power.

system.benefit: When using a Force Power that affects a single target, you can spend a Force Point to affect one additional target.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When using a Force Power that affects a single target, you can spend a Force Point to affect one additional target.

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to affect one target per four Character Levels.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to affect one target per four Character Levels.

system.benefit: When you use a Force Power that affects targets within an area (such as a radius or a cone), you can spend a Force Point to double the distance that the effect extends from your square (for example, a 6-square cone can be made into a 12-square cone).
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When you use a Force Power that affects targets within an area (such as a radius or a cone), you can spend a Force Point to double the distance that the effect extends from your square (for example, a 6-square cone can be made into a 12-square cone).

Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to multiply the distance the effect extends by 5 (making a 6-square cone into a 30-square cone).
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, you can spend a Destiny Point to multiply the distance the effect extends by 5 (making a 6-square cone into a 30-square cone).

system.benefit: When using a Force Power that allows you to maintain your concentration (such as Force Grip), you can spend a Force Point to sustain the Force Power as a Swift Action instead of a Standard Action for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point

When using a Force Power that allows you to maintain your concentration (such as Force Grip), you can spend a Force Point to sustain the Force Power as a Swift Action instead of a Standard Action for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier.

system.benefit: Whenever you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to add one use of any Force Power known by any ally within 12 squares of you (whether you know that Force Power or not) to your Force Power Suite. Once used, the Force Power cannot be regained by any means, and if the Force Power is not used by the end of your next turn, it is lost.
system.special: Additionally, you can enhance any Holocron you possess, adding your knowledge to its memory. You can create a Holocron Gatekeeper in your own image in that Holocron.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

Whenever you activate a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point to add one use of any Force Power known by any ally within 12 squares of you (whether you know that Force Power or not) to your Force Power Suite. Once used, the Force Power cannot be regained by any means, and if the Force Power is not used by the end of your next turn, it is lost.

You can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power lost at the end of the encounter instead of the end of your next turn.

Special: Additionally, you can enhance any Holocron you possess, adding your knowledge to its memory. You can create a Holocron Gatekeeper in your own image in that Holocron.
system.alternativeCost: You can spend a Destiny Point to have the Force Power lost at the end of the encounter instead of the end of your next turn.

system.benefit: When using a Force Power with a Cone Area Effect (such as Force Slam), you can spend a Force Point to instead affect a 1 square wide and (5 x Cone's length) squares long line.
system.description:
Cost: Force Point or Destiny Point

When using a Force Power with a Cone Area Effect (such as Force Slam), you can spend a Force Point to instead affect a 1 square wide and (5 x Cone's length) squares long line.

Alternatively, when using a Force Power with a Cone Area Effect, you can spend a Destiny Point to instead affect one or more targets of your choice within a number of squares of you equal to the Cone's length.
system.alternativeCost: Alternatively, when using a Force Power with a Cone Area Effect, you can spend a Destiny Point to instead affect one or more targets of your choice within a number of squares of you equal to the Cone's length.
